column3:
Thanks for your contribution!

But yes, in general we only do optimization changes when a benchmark proves that it speeds up something relevant in a statistically significant way. Changes that span the entire tree are also discouraged.

I think your changes look okay in themselves, except one inside `leveldb`. That's a subtree, changes to third-party libraries should go to their upstream r
Thanks for your speedy feedback @laanwj. I've removed the third party lib change. Your lack of concept ACKâ€¦ is that encouraging me to close this PR?
The UniValue changes are failing to compile; I don't think it has a constructor that could serve as a replacement for push_back.

Thanks @SamuelMarks, however I'm going to close this. As mentioned, if you're going to open optimization PRs, you should present some sort of benchmark. PRs that do repository wide refactoring, are also likely to disrupt other work. Regardless of any of that, these changes don't actually compile.\n\nIf you're planning on submitting more PRs, I'd suggest taking a look through [CONTRIBUTING.md](ht
